case.name: Australian Communications and Media Authority v Mobilegate Ltd A Company Incorporated in Hong Kong [2009] FCA 539 (22 May 2009)

the applicant file and serve any submissions and further material in relation to penalty and financial compensation orders against the first, second, fourth, fifth and seventh respondents on or before 17 september 2009. service of the above material be effected by the means set out in order 2 of the court's orders of 31 july 2009, namely, that the material be served on the respondents at the following addresses by prepaid post: 2.1. first respondent
tarek salcedo, 43 forbes street, west end, queensland, 4101 2.2. second respondent
denham & associates, suite 8, 3990 pacific highway, loganholme, queensland, 4219 2.3. fourth respondent
43 forbes street, west end, queensland, 4101 2.4. fifth respondent
43 forbes street, west end, queensland, 4101 2.5. seventh respondent

43 forbes street, west end, queensland, 4101 the matter be re-listed for directions in relation to any penalty hearing as against the first, second, fourth, fifth and seventh respondents at 9:30am on 18 september 2009.
whether serious question to be tried

citances.sentence: On 22 May 2009, for reasons which I then gave, I granted certain interlocutory injunctive relief on the application of the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA) - Australian Communications and Media Authority v Mobilegate Ltd A Company Incorporated in Hong Kong [2009] FCA 539. These reasons should be read in conjunction with those of 22 May 2009.

I accept Mr Webb's submission that the observations of Logan J in Australian Communications and Media Authority v Mobilegate Ltd A Company Incorporated in Hong Kong [2009] FCA 539 at [1] and [28] are distinguishable from the present matter.
